intro: Lotononis difformis, commonly known as the variable lotononis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, asymmetrical inflorescences. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple and blue. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and botanical collections.
